description: With this command dedicated parameters of an existing domain application can be modified.
availability: All users have access to this command.

paramaters.Definition: ModifyDomainApplication
Contact Handle ID
The application ID
The domain's authorization code
Contact Handle ID
The class of the application
If set to 1 the modification request will be accepted even if not all required parameters are set for the application
Nameserver Hostname

By submitting this parameter the registrant confirms that he is aware that the domain name matches a trademark registered in the Clearinghouse. This parameter can be obtained by querying a StatusTMDBClaim command for the respective claim key
Contact Handle ID
The registration period in years
Contact Handle ID
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions of a highly regulated TLD
Activates the trustee service
Identification Number / Code of Reference (e.g. Passport number, Business Certificate number, Act or Legislation number/code, etc.)
If the legal entity type or form of identification is "other", please enter the appropriate information to support the claim

This parameter can be used to display information about the maintainer, e.g. the provider of the domain, in the .ASIA whois

With this parameter you can specify an Operations and Notifications Contact (OPN/NOTF Contact) to designate the point of contact to whom documentary evidence requests, auction invitations, and reminders are to be sent
With this parameter, a contact handle can be used to display the provider or reseller through whose system the .ASIA domain has been registered

The DUNS number is a nine-digit number, issued by Dun & Bradstreet. DUNS is the abbreviation of Data Universal Numbering System. Companies with a valid DUNS number are still obliged having their head office in the territory of the European Union. The DUNS number can be provided using this parameter
Date of the declaration of the trademark registration

Other form than the possible values of the above parameter
ID of the registrant
Companies with a local identifier specific to a country of the European Economic Area can provide their local identifier using this parameter
Companies with a European trademark can additionally add their trademark number using this parameter

The registrant of the domain must one of 3 criteria:A: Victorian EntitiesB: Victorian ResidentsC: Associated Entities
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions
If set to 1 the registrant's details get disclosed

This number must be provided for individuals as well as for organizations. For individuals or companies located in Sweden a valid Swedish personal or organizational number must be stated (6 digits, dash, 4 digits). For individuals and companies outside of Sweden the ID number (e.g. Civic registration number, company registration number, or the equivalent) can consist of 4 to 123 characters.
The VAT-ID has to be stated for companies that are located inside the European Union but outside Sweden
Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions; only relevant for .NU domains

The value of this parameter has to be either 1 for a natural person whose primary place of domicile is a valid physical address in the City of New York or  2 for an entity or organization that has a physical street address in the City of New York

The enterprise ID, in the specific context of .swiss based on current rules, is the Swiss UID/IDE/IDI

If set to N, the registrant's contact data will not be shown in the WHOIS
With this parameter the way the domain will be displayed in the WHOIS can be selected

Set to 1 to accept the terms and conditions of a highly regulated TLD
Must be one of the following: P1: Business use for profit P2: Non-profit business, club, association, religious organization, etc.P3: Personal use P4: Education purposes  P5: Government purposes

Must be one of the following: C11: a United States citizen C12: a permanent resident of the United States of America or any of its posessions or territories.  C21: U.S. Organization incorporated within one of the 50 states or a U.S. Territory An entity or organization that has a bona fide presence in the United States of America or any of its possessions or territories. C31:  Regularly engages in lawful activities (sales of goods or services or other business, commercial or non-commercial, including not-for-profit relations in the United States)  C32: Entity has an office or other facility in the US.
Specify the two-letter country-code of the registrant (if Nexus Category is either C31 or C32)
